edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sprite

    public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic GameObject all visual elements of a game should either use directly or extend.

    Core functionality of GameObjects includes arbitrary positioning, scaling, and rotating in the scene graph, display of JavaFXNodes, and animation.

    GameObject generic `Features'

    Features are similar to `Components' in similar game engines; essentially, they are objects that can be looked up by the classes they are instances of. This can be used to extend GameObjects with generic functionality.

    For example, say you want to add to GameObject the ability to serialize themselves -- that is, the ability to store a String representation of themselves, for use in a save-game feature. You might do the following: 

     public interface Serializer {
   public String serialize();
 }
 ... (in some other file) ...
 GameObject bulletGameObject = ...
 Serializer s = new BulletSerializer();
 bulletGameObject.addFeature(s);

    Then later on, you might use the serializer as such: 

     public void saveGameObjects(Collection<GameObject> objects, PrintStream file) {
     for (GameObject g : objects) {
         if (g.hasFeature(Serializer.class)) {
             file.println(g.getFeature(Serializer.class).serialize());
         }
     }
 }

        Parameters:

      • getFeature

        public <T> T getFeature(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Retrieves a `feature' of the given type associated with this GameObject.

        GameObject for a discussion of what features are and how to use them.

        Parameters:
        type - the type (or supertype) of the feature to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the feature if it exists, null otherwise.

      • getFeatures

        public <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> getFeatures(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Retrieves all `features' of the given type associated with this GameObject.

        GameObject for a discussion of what features are and how to use them.

        Parameters:
        type - the type (or supertype) of the features to retrieve. E.g., passing in `Object.class' will retrieve all features on this game objects, because all features are subclasses of the java Object superclass.
        Returns:
        an Iterable over all features of the given type that this object contains.

      • hasFeature

        public <T> boolean hasFeature(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Checks whether this object contains a `feature' of the given type associated with this GameObject.

        GameObject for a discussion of what features are and how to use them.

        Parameters:
        type - the type (or supertype) of the feature to check for.
        Returns:
        true if this object has a feature of the given type, false otherwise.

      • playAnimation

        public void playAnimation(Animation animation)
        Plays the given animation, stopping any currently playing animations. Animations modify the position, rotate, and scale of an object over time.

        Parameters:
        animation - the animation to play

      • loopAnimation

        public void loopAnimation(Animation animation,
                          int count)
        Plays the given animation, stopping any currently playing animations, and loops it count number of times.

        Animations modify the position, rotate, and scale of an object over time.

        Parameters:
        animation - the animation to loop
        count - The number of times to play the animation. count = 0 will not play anything, count = 1 will play the animation exactly once. A negative value for count will cause the animation to loop infinitely.

      • loopAnimation

        public void loopAnimation(Animation animation)
        Plays the given animation in a loop forever.

        Animations modify the position, rotation, and scale of an object over time.

        Parameters:
        animation - the animation to loop

      • scale

        public void scale(double sx,
                  double sy)
        Scales this object by the given amount. Non-uniform scalings (ie not scaling sx and sy by the same amount) are not recommended as they can have undesirable effects (shearing) if this object has rotated children.
        Parameters:
        sx - the x scale
        sy - the y scale

      • scale

        public void scale(Scale scale)
        Scales this object by the given amount. Non-uniform scalings (ie not scaling sx and sy by the same amount) are not recommended as they can have undesirable effects (shearing) if this object has rotated children.
        Parameters:
        scale - the 2D scale

      • getFxNode

        protected javafx.scene.Group getFxNode()
        Returns this object's underlying JavaFX Group object. This allows child classes to modify some properties directly, such as the children list. This should be used with caution, to avoid breaking Trydent's scene graph.
        Returns:
